channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of stain (un1263) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 3 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, co no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023080251
item.description:
Report X-2023080251

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE DAMAGED PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL TOTE AND TAKEN TO THE HAZARDOUS MATERIAL STAGING AREA AWAY FROM PERSONNEL AND OTHER PACKAGES. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND THAT THE PLASTIC BOTTLE HAS A HOLE, WHICH IS CASUING THE LEAKAGE. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL PAIL AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023080242
item.description:
Report X-2023080242

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BEING LOOKED AT AND INVESTIGATED ON WHETHER IT NEEDED TO BE RTS OR SENT ON TO CUSTOMER. LOOKED TO VERIFY IF THE HAZMAT CERT WAS ON FILE SINCE PRIOR SCANS SHOWED IT WAS SENT BACK TO THE SHIPPER ONCE ALREADY. WHEN PKG WAS PICKED UP OFF THE GROUND, THE BOTTOM FELL OUT AND 3 BOTTLES BUSTED. THE DIRT WAS PUT OVER THE LIQUID TO KEEP IT CONTAINED AND PKG WAS SECURED. GLASS WAS SWEPT UP AND PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG ALONG WITH THE REST OF THE PKG. DescribePack: BOX WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM AND EMPLOYEE WHO LIFTED THE PKG WAS UNAWARE OF THAT. BOX FELL APART. CONTENTS FELL OUT OF THE BOTTOM. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: DIRT WAS PUT OVER THE LIQUID TO ABSORB AND THE GLASS WAS SWEPT UP AND PUT IN THE HAZMAT BAG WITH THE REST OF THE PKG

item.title: Report X-2023080195
item.description:
Report X-2023080195

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While being loaded onto delivery truck, the package handler noticed that the package was damp. He set it aside and informed QA of its condition and location. DescribePack: 4 of the 6 bottles had either loose seals, or their spray triggers were loose. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package placed in a hazmat bag, and was taken to the nearest QA cage for further processing.
